I am deeply disappointed Congress has given the OK to loosen the rules on some Wall Street banks. Removing common-sense safeguards that protect consumers is beyond irresponsible — we are repeating the same mistakes that created the 2008 financial crisis. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/divided-house-passes-major-bank-deregulation-bill-sends-to-trump/2018/05/22/6f3bb562-5dd2-11e8-a4a4-c070ef53f315_story.html
I am committed to bringing accountability, responsibility, and honesty to Wall Street, and I hope you'll stand with me in this fight.

When I was Attorney General, I saw firsthand the devastation of the financial crisis, with more than 150K CA families losing their homes to foreclosure. My team fought to make things right for them, and in 2012 we delivered a $20B settlement from the big banks to CA homeowners.
@Kattorney Thanks so much for your kind words!

Since the Religious Freedom Restoration Act (RFRA) was passed by Congress in 1993 with the original intent of protecting the rights of religious minorities, it has since been contorted and misappropriated to shield the mistreatment of women, children, and the LGBTQ community.
